se.fnord.katydid

Class DataTesters

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.fnord.katydid.DataTesters

  • public class DataTesters
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory-methods to create DataTester instances.

      static DataTester bytes(byte... bytes)
      Creates a tester for generating or verifying a list of byte values.
      static DataTester bytes(java.lang.String name, byte... bytes)
      Creates a tester for generating or verifying a list of byte values.
      static DataTester defer(DataTester tester)
      Modifies a tester to defer validation to a the pass after when it would ordinarily be executed.
      static DataTester fatal(DataTester tester)
      Modifies a tester to emit a fatal error on a non-fatal validation failure, thus stopping the validation of any subsequent testers or validation passes.

    • Method Detail

      • u8

        public static DataTester u8(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 8 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures.

        To test for the sequence 

             01 02 03 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(u8("data", 1, 2, 3, 4), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 8 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • u8

        public static DataTester u8(java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 8 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures.

        Equivalent to calling

        u8("u8", values)

        Parameters:
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 8 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values
        See Also:
        u8(String, Number...)

      • s8

        public static DataTester s8(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying signed (two's-complement) 8 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures.

        To test for the sequence 

             ff fe fd fc
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(s8("data", -1, -2, -3, -4), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to signed 8 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

        public static DataTester h8(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 8 bit values. Values will be presented in hexadecimal in reports and failures.

        To test for the sequence 

             01 02 03 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(h8("data", 0x01, 0x02, 0x03, 0x04), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 8 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • u16

        public static DataTester u16(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 16 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             01 01 02 02 03 03 04 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(u16("data", 257, 514, 771, 1028), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 16 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • u16

        public static DataTester u16(java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 16 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Equivalent to calling

        u16("u16", values)

        Parameters:
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 16 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values
        See Also:
        u16(String, Number...)

      • s16

        public static DataTester s16(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying signed (two's-complement) 16 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             ff ff ff fe ff fd ff fc
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(s16("data", -1, -2, -3, -4), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to signed 16 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

             01 01 02 02 03 03 04 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(h16("data", 0x0101, 0x0202, 0x0303, 0x0404), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 16 bit values before testing.
        Returns:

        public static DataTester u24(java.lang.String name,

        assertExact(u24("data", 65793, 131586, 197379, 263172), byteBuffer);

        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 24 bit values before testing.

      • h24

        public static DataTester h24(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 24 bit values. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             01 01 01 02 02 02 03 03 03 04 04 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(h24("data",
        0x010101, 0x020202,
        0x030303, 0x040404), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 24 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • u32

        public static DataTester u32(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 32 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             01 01 01 01 02 02 02 02 03 03 03 03 04 04 04 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(u32("data",
        16843009, 33686018,
        50529027, 67372036), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 32 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • h32

        public static DataTester h32(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 32 bit values. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             01 01 01 01 02 02 02 02 03 03 03 03 04 04 04 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(h24("data",
        0x01010101, 0x02020202,
        0x03030303, 0x04040404), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 32 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • u64

        public static DataTester u64(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 64 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             01 01 01 01 01 01 01 01 02 02 02 02 02 02 02 02
     03 03 03 03 03 03 03 03 04 04 04 04 04 04 04 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(u64("data",
        72340172838076673L, 144680345676153346L,
        217020518514230019L, 289360691352306692L), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 64 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • s64

        public static DataTester s64(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying signed (two's-complement) 64 bit values. Values will be presented in decimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff fe
     ff ff ff ff ff ff ff fd ff ff ff ff ff ff ff fc
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(s32("data", -1, -2, -3, -4), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to signed 64 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • h64

        public static DataTester h64(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Number... values)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying unsigned 64 bit values. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Given a buffer in big endian format, to test for the sequence: 

             01 01 01 01 01 01 01 01 02 02 02 02 02 02 02 02
     03 03 03 03 03 03 03 03 04 04 04 04 04 04 04 04
        The following code could be used:

        assertExact(h24("data",
        0x0101010101010101L, 0x0202020202020202L,
        0x0303030303030303L, 0x0404040404040404L), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        values - a list of values to generate or validate. Will be converted to unsigned 64 bit values before testing.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • h64

      • struct

        public static DataTester struct(java.lang.String name,
                DataTester... elements)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a collection of testers. Value names will be presented in a structured form like structName.elementName whereas the values themselves will be presented in the form specified by its tester. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Example: assertExact(struct("message",
        u8("length", 15),
        h16("code", 0x1010),
        h32("propertyKey", 0x12345678),
        s64("propertyValue", -1)), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        elements - a list of testers to generate or validate. Each tester will be evaluated in the order they are specified.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • struct

        public static DataTester struct(DataTester... elements)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a collection of testers. Value names will be presented in a structured form like structName.elementName whereas the values themselves will be presented in the form specified by its tester. Testing and generation endianness is determined by the byte order of the buffer.

        Equivalent to calling struct("struct", elements)

        Parameters:
        elements - a list of testers to generate or validate. Each tester will be evaluated in the order they are specified.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values
        See Also:
        struct(String, DataTester...)

      • list

        public static DataTester list(java.lang.String name,
              DataTester... elements)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a collection of testers. Value names will be presented in a list form like structName[index] whereas the values themselves will be presented in the form specified by its tester.

        Example: assertExact(list("names",
        struct("name", u8("length", 5), utf8("text", "name1")),
        struct("name", u8("length", 5), utf8("text", "name2")),
        struct("name", u8("length", 5), utf8("text", "name3")))), byteBuffer);

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        elements - a list of testers to generate or validate. Each tester will be evaluated in the order they are specified.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values

      • list

        public static DataTester list(DataTester... elements)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a collection of testers. Value names will be presented in a list form like structName[index] whereas the values themselves will be presented in the form specified by its tester.

        Equivalent to calling

        list("list", elements)

        Parameters:
        elements - a list of testers to generate or validate. Each tester will be evaluated in the order they are specified.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the values
        See Also:
        list(String, DataTester...)

      • utf8

        public static DataTester utf8(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String value)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying utf-8 encoded strings. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures.

        Example:

        assertExact(utf8("name", "value"), byteBuffer);

        Equivalent to calling

        bytes(name, value.getBytes(UTF_8))

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        value - a string whose utf-8 representation to generate or validate.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value

      • utf8

        public static DataTester utf8(java.lang.String value)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying utf-8 encoded strings. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures.

        Equivalent to calling

        utf8("utf8", value)

        Parameters:
        value - a string whose utf-8 representation to generate or validate.
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value
        See Also:
        utf8(String, String)

      • bytes

        public static DataTester bytes(java.lang.String name,
               byte... bytes)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a list of byte values. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures.

        Example

        bytes("something", "bytes".getBytes(UTF_16BE))

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        bytes - an array of bytes to generate or validate
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value

      • bytes

        public static DataTester bytes(byte... bytes)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a list of byte values. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures.

        Equivalent to calling

        bytes("bytes", bytes)

        Parameters:
        bytes - an array of bytes to generate or validate
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value
        See Also:
        bytes(String, byte...)

      • skip

        public static DataTester skip(java.lang.String name,
              int size)
        Creates a tester for skipping a number of bytes in when testing. When generating, this tester will generate size zero-bytes.

        Example

        skip("unused", size)

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        size - the number of bytes to skip
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value
        See Also:
        zero(String, int)

      • skip

        public static DataTester skip(int size)
        Creates a tester for skipping a number of bytes in when testing. When generating, this tester will generate size zero-bytes.

        Equivalent to calling

        skip("skip", bytes)

        Parameters:
        size - the number of bytes to skip
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value
        See Also:
        skip(String, int)

      • zero

        public static DataTester zero(java.lang.String name,
              int count)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a sequence of count of zero-bytes. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures.

        Example

        zero("padding", 42)

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tester.
        count - the number of bytes to skip
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value
        See Also:
        skip(String, int)

      • zero

        public static DataTester zero(int count)
        Creates a tester for generating or verifying a sequence of count of zero-bytes. Values will be presented in hexadecimal form in reports and failures.

        Equivalent to calling

        zero("zero", count)

        Parameters:
        count - the number of bytes to skip
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value
        See Also:
        zero(String, int)

      • defer

        public static DataTester defer(DataTester tester)
        Modifies a tester to defer validation to a the pass after when it would ordinarily be executed. Has no effect on generation.
        Parameters:
        tester - the tester whose execution is to be deferred
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value

      • fatal

        public static DataTester fatal(DataTester tester)
        Modifies a tester to emit a fatal error on a non-fatal validation failure, thus stopping the validation of any subsequent testers or validation passes. Has no effect on generation.
        Parameters:
        tester - the tester whose execution result is to be modified
        Returns:
        the DataTester for generating or verifying the value
